episodes.title: 350-Black & Cultivated AF W/LaNisa Frederick
episodes.description:
Alvin and LaNisa Frederick explore the themes of personal experiences in cults, the impact of art and performance, and the creation of LaNisa's podcast 'Black and Cultivated.' They delve into the complexities of cult dynamics, particularly focusing on British Israelism and its implications of white supremacy. LaNisa shares her journey of growing up in a cult, the financial control exerted by such organizations, and the cultural realizations that come from interacting with the outside world. In this conversation, LaNisa Frederick and Alvin delve into the complexities of cult dynamics, particularly within religious organizations. LaNisa Frederick and Alvin delve into the intertwining of politics and religion, the racial dynamics and class struggles in America, the cult-like following of political figures, and the dystopian outlook for the future of the country. They also discuss cultural identity and the perception of America on the international stage, highlighting the complexities and challenges faced by individuals in today's society.
